title: Caprice, 47, wows in a chainmail wrap dress at the National Lottery Awards
text:
She's been gearing up to compete on the upcoming edition of Dancing On Ice, set to air on ITV in the new year.

And Caprice turned heads ahead of her dance stint as she attended the National Lottery Awards 2019 at London's BBC Television Centre on Tuesday evening.

The former model, 47, took the plunge as she slipped her phenomenal physique into a silver chainmail wrap dress for her glitzy appearance.

She's still got it! Caprice turned heads as she attended the National Lottery Awards 2019 at London 's BBC Television Centre on Tuesday evening

Flashing a hint of her cleavage and her lean legs, the homewear brand owner's ensemble was complete with a plunging neckline and a daring thigh-high slit.

The blonde beauty caught the eye as she boosted her frame in a pair of chunky platform stilettos.

Adding even more glamour to her look, the reality star accessorised with diamond chandelier earrings.

The TV star styled her glossy tresses into classic curls, while her youthful-looking complexion was highlighted with heavily-applied make-up.

The ceremony celebrates the work from UK's favourite Lottery-funded projects and athletes.

Speaking on the important cause, Tracey Crouch, Minister for Sport and Civil Society, previously said: 'For more than twenty years, National Lottery funding has helped support the successful careers of our sporting heroes - past and present, providing world-class training that has taken them to medal podiums across the globe.'

'I want to thank National Lottery players for supporting our elite athletes, who continue to inspire the nation. I urge everyone to get out there and vote for their favourite', she added.

Celebrating its 25th birthday, the charity's event was hosted by Ore Oduba and will be aired on November 19 at 11pm on BBC One.

Earlier this month, Caprice was announced as the final celebrity taking party in Dancing On Ice 2020.

The actress confirmed the exciting news in a pre-recorded message on Lorraine after admitting that she has 'no nerves' about the gruelling challenge.

TV personality Caprice will join a slew of stars including veteran presenter Trisha Goddard, Love Island's Maura Higgins and Michael Barrymore taking to the rice for the new series.
